data.title: How do I reference an author with a hyphenated or two
data.text:
The APA Style format for author names in reference list entries is to provide the author’s surname(s) followed by the initials of their given name(s).

If a surname hyphenated include both names and the hyphen in the reference list entry and the in-text citation.

Example:

Full name Name in reference list Name in in-text citation Diego J. Rivera-Gutierrez Rivera-Gutierrez, D. J. (2016). (Rivera-Gutierrez, 2016)

If an author's first name is hyphenated, use a hyphen + periods after each initial for the reference list entry only.

Example

Full name Name in reference list Name in in-text citation Hans-Jörg Schmid Schmid, H.-J (Schmid, 2017)

For more examples see the APA blog post below.
